Sabbatical Program.text: You may take a sabbatical once you have completed five years of continuous regular employment (adjusted as applicable).
A sabbatical gives you an opportunity to take extended time off to relax, recharge and reenergize for your return to work with a renewed commitment to supporting Adobe’s future success.
Adobe offers eligible employees a Sabbatical Program.
You are eligible for the Adobe Sabbatical Program if you are a regular U.S. employee and are scheduled to work at least 24 hours per week.
You do not use your sabbatical within 24 months of becoming eligible.
The Adobe Sabbatical Program is discontinued.
The length of your sabbatical is dependent on your active, continuous service as an Adobe employee.
However, once you reach your five years of continuous service with Adobe, your service with your prior company will be counted to determine the length of your sabbatical (four, five, or six weeks).
Your prior two years of employment in the U.S. will count towards your 5 years of sabbatical-eligible service so you will become eligible for sabbatical on January 20, 2023.
On March 15, 2023, you will become eligible for your first sabbatical, as long as you continue to be an eligible employee without a break in service.
Keep in mind that the purpose of a sabbatical is to provide you with extended time away from work in order to rejuvenate and then return to work.
Once you have completed five years of continuous regular employment, you may take a sabbatical.
Leave Adobe and are rehired as a regular employee, your prior years of service will not count toward your five years of active, continuous service.

Have worked at Adobe as an Intern and convert to an eligible employee, with no break in service from internship to eligible employee status, your sabbatical eligibility will start as of your regular hire date.
A sabbatical is a long time to be away from your job, and your manager will need to plan for your absence and your return to work.

Sabbaticals are offered to employees in order to reward them for their past contributions and to refresh them so that they can make additional valuable contributions to Adobe following their sabbatical.
Before taking your sabbatical you should obtain your manager’s approval and coordinate the dates during which you will be out.
Sabbatical leave must be taken in one continuous period.

The following are examples of eligibility determinations:

You remain an employee of Adobe while you are on a sabbatical, and you are expected to return to work at Adobe following the completion of your sabbatical.

If you are an employee on a commission plan and/or are participating in the AIP, you will be paid as you would have been paid had you not gone on sabbatical (i.e., based on actual goal/commissions achievement, not on TTC).

Question 1.question: What is the Adobe Sabbatical Program and when are employees eligible for it?
Question 1.statement: The Adobe Sabbatical Program is a program that provides eligible U.S. employees an opportunity to take an extended time off to relax, recharge, and reenergize, as well as to reward them for their past contributions and to refresh them so they can make additional valuable contributions to Adobe following their sabbatical. The length of the sabbatical depends on the employee's active, continuous service as an Adobe employee, and they may use it for any purpose as long as it does not conflict with Adobe's interests. Employees are eligible for the Adobe Sabbatical Program if they are regular U.S. employees who are scheduled to work at least 24 hours per week, and their sabbatical eligibility will start as of their regular hire date if they have worked at Adobe as an intern and converted to an eligible employee with no break in service. The program was discontinued, but effective 1/1/2015, Adobe will not adjust an employee’s sabbatical date unless the leave exceeds one year of duration. It is anticipated and expected that employees who take a sabbatical will return to work at Adobe following the sabbatical.

Question 2.question: How is the length of the sabbatical determined and what are the conditions for using it?
Question 2.statement: The length of the sabbatical is dependent on the employee's active, continuous service as an Adobe employee. After five years of continuous service with Adobe, the service with the previous company will be counted to determine the length of the sabbatical, which could be four, five, or six weeks. If an employee takes medical or personal leave beyond 365 calendar days, any time off exceeding the 365 calendar days will not count towards the sabbatical's five-year requirement. Sabbatical eligibility dates were adjusted by the length of leave that extended beyond 30 calendar days up to the end of 2014. To use sabbatical, employees must take it within 24 months after becoming eligible, and they cannot use previous employment to dictate the sabbatical length.

Question 3.question: What are the expectations for employees while they are on sabbatical and how is their return to work managed?
Question 3.statement: A sabbatical is an extended time given to employees by Adobe to refresh and revitalize themselves to make additional valuable contributions to the company once they return to work. Employees who have completed five years of continuous regular employment are eligible for sabbaticals, and the length of the sabbatical depends on their active, continuous service. While on sabbatical, all regular benefits continue as if an employee was actively working. It is expected that employees who take a sabbatical will return to work, and the purpose is to provide them with extended time away from work in order to rejuvenate, initiating their renewed commitment to supporting Adobe’s future success. As a sabbatical is a long time to be away from work, it’s the manager's responsibility to plan the employee's return to work. The company understands that employees will return to work with renewed energy and commitment following their sabbatical.
